newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-ATLETICO CRASH AS BARCELONA REGAIN LEAD IN SPAIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ATLETICO CRASH AS BARCELONA REGAIN LEAD IN SPAIN.

text.p: Barcelona regained the lead in the Spanish first division on Wednesday with a hard-fought 1-0 win at Sevilla which puts Bobby Robson's side two points ahead of Real Madrid, 2-1 winners at Zaragoza on Tuesday.
A late goal by Luis Enrique Martinez secured the points after Sevilla had seen two goals disallowed for offside.

The real surprise of the night's league programme came at the Vicente Calderon stadium where Atletico Madrid lost 3-1 to Rayo Vallecano, a defeat that leaves the champions 12 points off the pace after just nine games.

Third-placed Deportivo Coruna managed only a 1-1 draw at Racing Santander and fall two points behind Real Madrid while fourth-placed Real Betis are a further point back after coming home from Oviedo with the same score.
